Elon Musk's xAI raises $6 billion funding from BlackRock, Nvidia, AMD, and others | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Elon Musk's xAI Secures $6 Billion in Funding from Major Investors

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI, successfully raised $6 billion in a Series C funding round from prominent investors, including BlackRock, Nvidia, and AMD, to enhance its AI infrastructure.

  • The funding was announced via xAI's official blog.
  • Series C funding will be used for advancing infrastructure and R&D.
  • This marks the second funding round in 2024, following a similar $6 billion Series B round in May.
  • Key participants in this round include a16z, Fidelity, and Morgan Stanley.
  • Major initiatives from xAI include the launch of Colossus, the world's largest AI supercomputer, and Grok 2, its second language model.
“The funds from this financing round will be used to further accelerate our advanced infrastructure, ship groundbreaking products that will be used by billions of people.” — xAI

Looking to the future, xAI is developing Grok 3 and other innovative products to enhance how individuals and businesses engage with technology.
newTitle: Elon Musk's xAI Secures $6 Billion in Funding from Major Investors

title: 24Seven sues Godfrey Phillips India for trademark violation - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
India’s growth trajectory to lift in H2FY25 because of resilient domestic private consumption: RBI bulleti - The Economic Times
summary:
India’s Growth Trajectory to Lift in H2FY25 Due to Resilient Domestic Consumption, Says RBI Bulletin

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Reserve Bank of India Bulletin

India’s growth trajectory is set to improve in the second half of 2024-25, primarily fueled by strong domestic private consumption.

Key insights from the RBI bulletin highlight significant factors contributing to India's economic outlook, amid ongoing challenges.

  • India's growth outlook is supported by resilient private consumption demand.
  • Record foodgrains production and momentum in rural demand are key drivers.
  • Sustained government spending on infrastructure is expected to foster growth.
  • The economy grew at its slowest pace in nearly two years, with a GDP growth of 5.4%.
  • Inflation remains a concern, exceeding the RBI’s target of 4%.
  • High prices have slowed demand, but easing food prices offer some relief.
  • Strong festival activity indicates recovering momentum in the economy.
“High frequency indicators for the third quarter indicate that the Indian economy is recovering from the slowdown in Q2.” - RBI Bulletin

The RBI’s analysis suggests that while certain global factors pose risks, there is optimism about a recovery in India's economic performance.
newTitle: India’s Growth Trajectory to Lift in H2FY25 Due to Resilient Domestic Consumption, Says RBI Bulletin

title: Why American Airlines grounded all US flights for an hour on busy Christmas Eve - The Times of India
summary:
Why American Airlines Grounded All US Flights for an Hour on Busy Christmas Eve

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Times of India

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines caused a disruption in air travel by grounding all its flights across the United States for over an hour due to operational issues, impacting numerous travelers during one of the busiest travel days of the year.

  • The grounding occurred for about one hour, creating significant delays.
  • The disruption affected thousands of passengers and thousands of flights nationwide.
  • The decision was made to ensure safety and operational efficiency.
“Safety is our top priority, and we made this decision to ensure that all operations are secure and reliable during peak travel times,” said an airline spokesperson.

This incident highlights the challenges and responsibilities airlines face during high-demand periods, emphasizing the importance of operational integrity and passenger safety.
newTitle: Why American Airlines Grounded All Flights on Christmas Eve

title: American Airlines, World's Largest, Grounds All US Flights On Christmas Eve - NDTV
summary:
American Airlines Grounds All US Flights on Christmas Eve Due to Technical Glitch

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Reuters

On Christmas Eve, American Airlines, the world's largest airline carrier, grounded all its flights in the United States due to a technical glitch. This disruption occurs during one of the busiest travel times of the year.

  • American Airlines faced a technical glitch leading to the grounding of all US flights.
  • The airline informed passengers of the situation and promised updates every 15 minutes.
  • Many passengers expressed frustration on social media about the cancellations and inconveniences.
  • Shares of American Airlines fell by 3.8% before market opening.
  • This incident follows a notable Microsoft outage that impacted various industries globally.
“Our teams are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible, and we apologize to our customers for the inconvenience.” - American Airlines

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in airline operations during peak travel seasons, raising questions about the reliability of technological systems in critical infrastructure.
newTitle: American Airlines Grounds All US Flights on Christmas Eve Due to Technical Glitch

title: Medical devices maker Poly Medicure to focus on exports amid geopolitical shift | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Medical devices maker Poly Medicure to focus on exports amid geopolitical shift

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

Indian medical equipment manufacturer Poly Medicure Ltd. is increasing its focus on export markets due to growing demand in the US and a global movement to diversify supply chains away from China.

  • Poly Medicure is responding to a global narrative of shifting technology from China.
  • The company has acknowledged significant demand in the US market.
  • Himanshu Baid, managing director, emphasizes the need for a bold approach in light of these shifts.
“The narrative is very clear globally, that people want to move technology away from China...” - Himanshu Baid

The strategic shift towards exports may help Poly Medicure align with changing international market dynamics while addressing increasing demands.
newTitle: Poly Medicure Shifts Focus to Exports Amid Global Supply Chain Changes

Motilal Oswal has outlined its top 10 stock picks for 2025 across multiple sectors, including IT, healthcare, BFSI, and real estate, with potential upsides based on robust growth prospects.

Ventive Hospitality IPO subscribed 9.80 times on Day 3; Check latest GMP, subscription status, other details | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Ventive Hospitality IPO Subscribed 9.80 Times on Day 3

Publication Date: December 24, 2023 Source: Live Mint

Luxury hospitality business developer Ventive Hospitality's initial public offering (IPO) received a strong response, closing at 9.80 times subscription on the final day.

Key Points:

  • The IPO aimed to raise ₹1,600 crore by offering 2.49 crore equity shares.
  • Non-Institutional Investors subscribed 13.85 times, while Qualified Institutional Buyers came in at 9.08 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) is currently ₹56 per share, indicating expected listing at ₹699.
  • The funds will be used to pay off borrowings and for general corporate purposes.
“The IPO raised ₹719.5 crore from anchor investors ahead of the public issue.”

Conclusion: The strong subscription rates indicate robust investor interest in Ventive Hospitality, with its shares expected to list on December 30.
newTitle: Ventive Hospitality IPO Subscribed 9.80 Times on Day 3

title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 9.09x on the second day; Check GMP, subscription | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 9.09x on the second day; Check GMP, subscription

Date: 24 Dec, 2024
Source: Live Mint

The Unimech Aerospace IPO has seen tremendous interest as it enters its second day of bidding. The price band has been set between ₹745-785 per share, with a public offer totaling ₹500 crore.

  • The IPO was subscribed 9.09x on the second day.
  • Non-Institutional Investors portion subscribed 12.07x.
  • Retail investors portion subscribed 10.30x.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) stands at ₹510.
  • Expected listing price of shares approximately ₹1,295, reflecting a premium of 64.97%.
The public issue of Unimech Aerospace was subscribed for 4,27,66,226 shares against the 47,04,028 shares available.

The overwhelming response signifies strong investor confidence in Unimech's business model and growth trajectory.
newTitle: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Subscription Status and GMP Insights

title: Justin Sun wants to be the Musk of crypto - Mint
summary:
Justin Sun Wants to Be the Musk of Crypto

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Company Business News

Justin Sun, founder of the Tron blockchain, has become prominent in the cryptocurrency market, aligning with President-elect Donald Trump.

  • Invested $30 million in Trump-backed crypto project, World Liberty Financial.
  • His investment came amid struggles for the project to meet fundraising targets.
  • Sun serves as an adviser, ensuring potential payouts for the Trump family.
“President-elect Donald Trump’s newest ally in the cryptocurrency markets is a Chinese-born entrepreneur who has been accused of fraud by U.S. regulators and recently spent $6.2 million on a banana.”

This article discusses Sun's financial commitment and potential influence in the cryptocurrency landscape as he aims to establish himself as a key player in the industry.

title: Only One Bag, Not More Than 7kg: New Rules For Hand Luggage On Flights - News18
summary:
Only One Bag, Not More Than 7kg: New Rules For Hand Luggage On Flights

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: News18

If traveling by air, passengers should know the new hand baggage policy by the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) to avoid complications.

  • Passengers are allowed only one hand or cabin bag on board.
  • Hand baggage must not exceed 7 kg for economy class; 10 kg for first/business class.
  • Bag dimensions must not exceed 55 cm x 40 cm x 20 cm.
  • Exemption for tickets booked before May 2, 2024: up to 12 kg for business class.
  • Indigo Airlines also allows one cabin bag with a personal item not exceeding 3 kg.
“Being unaware of these rules could lead to avoidable complications upon arrival.”

The new regulations emphasize the need for travelers to adapt to changing airline policies to ensure a smoother travel experience.
newTitle: Only One Bag, Not More Than 7kg: New Rules For Hand Luggage On Flights

title: Big day today! Transrail Lighting IPO allotment status online - Will you get shares? - ET Now
summary:
Big day today! Transrail Lighting IPO allotment status online - Will you get shares?

Updated Dec 24, 2024 15:25 IST | Source: ET NOW

The Transrail Lighting IPO allotment status is expected to be finalized today and will be available online on the registrar's website and BSE website.

  • The IPO was subscribed 80.80 times with a total bid for 1,12,44,40,452 shares against 1,39,16,742 shares on offer.
  • The non-institutional investors' quota was subscribed 76.41 times, and the retail portion was subscribed 22.07 times.
  • The qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) portion received an outstanding subscription rate of 201.06 times.

The allotment can be checked by entering the PAN number on the registrar's website. The shares are set to list on NSE and BSE on December 27, 2024, starting at 10 AM.

"Transrail Lighting shares are trading at a premium of around Rs 192, indicating a grey market premium of approximately 44%."

It is essential for potential investors to consult their financial advisors before making investment decisions.
newTitle: Transrail Lighting IPO Allotment Status: What Investors Need to Know

title: Indian state refiners may buy Mideast spot oil to replace Russian shortfall - The Economic Times
How India bought, craved, and consumed in 2024 - The Economic Times
summary:
How India bought, craved, and consumed in 2024

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

In 2024, India's consumer landscape was defined by a slowing economy paired with a shift towards premium products, showcasing a complex consumer behavior amidst economic challenges.

  • Despite a drop in private consumption, the trend of premiumisation gained momentum, with consumers opting for high-end products.
  • The rise of quick commerce platforms made it easier for consumers to purchase premium items.
  • Splurging has become normalized, evident in rising wedding budgets and concert ticket sales.
  • Rural demand for products grew at a faster rate than urban demand.
  • The retail lending sector expanded, bolstered by increased credit card usage and personal loans.
“In 2024, splurging has evolved from a taboo to a social norm.”

As the year concludes, India's consumer market remains in flux, with premiumisation and the impact of quick commerce reshaping shopping behaviors.
newTitle: How India bought, craved, and consumed in 2024

title: 2025 Honda SP 160 launched at Rs. 1.22 lakh - BikeWale
Telecom stocks in focus: Jefferies expects Bharti and Jio to continue gaining market share - CNBCTV18
summary:
Telecom stocks in focus: Jefferies expects Bharti and Jio to continue gaining market share

Date: December 24, 2024; Source: CNBC TV18

Jefferies has noted a significant increase in the active subscriber base of the telecom sector, while projecting that Bharti Airtel and Jio will continue to gain market share.

  • Active subscriber base increased by 6.8 million month-on-month in October 2024.
  • Bharti Airtel led in data subscriber additions, reflecting a premium customer mix.
  • Jio maintained the top market share position at 39.9% despite a significant loss of active 4G customers.
  • Vodafone Idea's user loss increased from 15.5 lakh to 19.77 lakh.
  • The market share for private access service providers reached 91.78% of wireless subscribers.
“Bharti and RJio’s market share inched up 60bp MoM each, and their combined market share in FBB now stands at ~53%.”

This strategic analysis by Jefferies highlights the ongoing competitive dynamics within India's telecom sector, where regulatory adjustments may further shape market conditions.
newTitle: Telecom Stocks: Jefferies Anticipates Market Share Gains for Bharti and Jio

title: CATL Unveils Chassis It Says Can Withstand Fires From Crashes | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
CATL Unveils Chassis It Says Can Withstand Fires From Crashes

Date: Unknown | Source: Bloomberg

Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. unveiled a new car chassis with an integrated battery designed to withstand fires or explosions from high-impact collisions.

  • The chassis can decouple from the car body and absorb energy from collisions up to 120 kms/hour.
  • Chinese EV brand Avatr is collaborating with CATL to develop cars based on this chassis.
  • The development aims to address consumer fears regarding EV battery fires.
  • CATL is expanding its offerings beyond batteries amidst slowing demand for pure-battery vehicles.
  • The company plans to roll out 1,000 battery swapping stations by the end of 2025.
The risk of EV battery fires, which are difficult to extinguish, is a detraction for some would-be buyers.

CATL's innovations aim to enhance EV adoption and reduce costs by addressing safety concerns.
newTitle: CATL Unveils Chassis It Says Can Withstand Fires From Crashes

title: Dabur takes Patanjali to Delhi High Court over disparaging Chyawanprash ad - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Dabur Takes Legal Action Against Patanjali Over Chyawanprash Ads

Published on: 24 Dec 2024, 7:20 am | Source: Delhi High Court

Dabur has filed a lawsuit against Patanjali Ayurved at the Delhi High Court, claiming that Patanjali's advertisements disparage its Chyawanprash products.

  • Dabur is seeking to restrain Patanjali from airing these advertisements.
  • Justice Mini Pushkarna initially considered mediation but opted for a hearing due to Dabur's urgent request.
  • The ads feature Patanjali's founder Swami Ramdev, suggesting other Chyawanprash brands are 'fake' and lack authenticity.
  • Dabur holds a 61.6% market share in the Chyawanprash segment of the Ayurvedic market.
  • The ads have been broadcasted 900 times in the past 3 days across several channels.
“Jinko Ayurved aur Vedo ka gyaan nahi, Charak, Sushrut, Dhanwantari aur Chyawanrishi ke parampara mei ‘original’ Chyawanprash kaise bana payenge?”

The case reflects ongoing tensions in the Ayurvedic product market, highlighting issues of authenticity and consumer trust in traditional remedies.
newTitle: Dabur Takes Legal Action Against Patanjali Over Chyawanprash Ads

title: Reliance May Be Dethroned As India's Largest Listed Firm Soon - NDTV Profit
summary:
Reliance May Be Dethroned As India's Largest Listed Firm Soon

Date: 24 Dec 2024

Source: NDTV Profit

Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd. has experienced a significant decline of over 23% from its peak in July of this year. Major competitors, Tata Consultancy Ltd. and HDFC Bank Ltd., are rising rapidly, posing a threat to Reliance's status as India's largest listed company.

  • Reliance Industries Ltd. has fallen over 23% from its peak in July.
  • If stock drops 5% in remaining sessions, will record longest losing streak since Covid-19 market slump.
  • Potentially snapping a decade-long trend of positive yearly returns.
  • Tata Consultancy Ltd. and HDFC Bank Ltd. are catching up in market capitalization.
  • Earnings per share estimates for Reliance have decreased by 16% this fiscal year.
“Even as analysts factor in lower earnings projections for the company, the consensus price target still implies an upside of over 30%, which is the most bullish they've been on the stock in nearly five years.”

The article highlights the shifting dynamics in the Indian corporate landscape, with Reliance facing challenges that may result in it being dethroned as the market leader.
newTitle: Reliance May Be Dethroned As India's Largest Listed Firm Soon

title: Mukesh Ambani signs Rs 500000000 mega deal with Gautam Adani, acquires 26% stake in…, the company is.... - India.com
summary:
Mukesh Ambani Acquires 26% Stake in Mahan Energen from Gautam Adani

Date: March 27, 2024 | Source: India.com

In a significant corporate move, Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) has acquired a 26% stake in Mahan Energen Ltd, a subsidiary of Gautam Adani’s Adani Power Ltd.

  • RIL will purchase 5 crore equity shares of Mahan Energen at a total of ₹50 crore.
  • The acquisition enables RIL to utilize 500 MW of electricity for captive purposes from Mahan Energen.
  • The deal fulfills regulatory requirements allowing access to self-generated electricity.
  • Despite media speculation of rivalry, Ambani and Adani maintain largely complementary interests.
  • This agreement is expected to be completed within two weeks, subject to regulatory approvals.
This synergy highlights a moment of innovation in India's energy sector.

The collaboration between RIL and Adani Power signals a strategic alliance aimed at advancing renewable energy initiatives and ensuring a stable power supply.
newTitle: Mukesh Ambani Acquires 26% Stake in Mahan Energen from Gautam Adani
